result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel James Corder

defendant.name: Corder, Daniel James
defendant.address: 2215 North Vel R Phillips Avenue,30, Milwaukee, WI 53212

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel James Corder in court, in custody.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan in court for Daniel James Corder.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Defense requests adjourned date for plea and sentencing to allow time for Defense to receive documentation to provide a complete sentencing memorandum to the Court.  Court finds good cause to grant the request.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Daniel James Corder not in court, in custody.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan in court for Daniel James Corder.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests a plea and sentencing hearing be set.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Daniel James Corder not in court, in custody.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan in court for Daniel James Corder.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests additional time to review digital discovery with Defendant. Request granted and adjourned to Br. 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Mindy M. Nolan in court, defendant Daniel James Corder not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for Attorney Amy Spanczal for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  Defense has received some discovery and an offer from the State.  Parties are in negotiation discussions. Court sets deadline of 8/18/2022 for the State to turnover all discovery including body camera footage. Appropriate sanctions may result for failure to turnover discovery as ordered including exclusion of use of certain discovery as evidence.

Defense withdraws the Prompt Disposition which was filed.
Defense requests adjourned Scheduling Conference. 

Matter adjourned to Br. 9.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed in error and moved to correct case.

Defendant Daniel James Corder in court with Attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Daniel James Corder in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer J. Kaye. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court. Court enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Daniel James Corder in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Daniel James Corder in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel James Corder appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 049059,
Payable Number: 1008459,
Receipt Number: 22RP020882,
Amount: $20.00
